question: the mass of 1 cubic meter of a substance is 400 kilograms under certain conditions. What is the volume, in cubic centimeters, of 1 gram of this substance under these conditions? (1 kilogram = 1,000 grams and 1 cubic meter = 1,000,000 cubic centimeters)
solution:
The mass of 1 gram of the substance is 1/1000 of the mass of 1 kilogram, so it is 400/1000 = 0.4 kilograms.
The volume of 0.4 kilograms of the substance is 0.4/400 = 0.001 cubic meters.
The volume of 0.001 cubic meters is 0.001 x 1,000,000 = 1,000 cubic centimeters.
#### 1,000

question: a train is moving at 4/5 of its usual speed. the train is 30 minutes too late. what is the usual time (in hours) for the train to complete the journey?
solution:
Let x be the usual time for the train to complete the journey.
Let y be the usual speed of the train.
Then, the distance is the same, so xy = (4/5)x(y+30)
Expanding, we get xy = (4/5)xy + 30(4/5)x
Subtracting (4/5)xy from both sides, we get xy - (4/5)xy = 30(4/5)x
Simplifying, we get (1/5)xy = 24x
Dividing both sides by x, we get (1/5)y = 24
Multiplying both sides by 5, we get y = 120
So, the usual time for the train to complete the journey is x = 120/120 = 1 hour.
#### 1

question: A light flashes every 20 seconds, how many times will it flash in 1/4 of an hour?
solution:
There are 60 seconds in a minute, so 1/4 of an hour is 15 minutes, which is 15 x 60 = 900 seconds.
The light flashes 900 / 20 = 45 times in 1/4 of an hour.
#### 45

question: The angle between the minute hand and the hour hand of a clock when the time is 4.20 Â° is
solution:
The angle made by the hour hand in 20 minutes = (1/2) * (20) = 10 degrees
The angle made by the minute hand in 20 minutes = (6) * (20) = 120 degrees
The angle between the hands = |10 - 120| = 110 degrees
#### 110

question: a boatman goes 3 km against the current of the stream in 3 hour and goes 1 km along the current in 30 minutes . how long will it take to go 3 km in stationary water ?
solution:
Let x be the speed of the boat in still water and y be the speed of the current.
Then, 3/(x-y) = 3 and 1/(x+y) = 0.5
Solving the equations, we get x = 5 and y = 2
So, the time taken to go 3 km in stationary water is 3/5 = 0.6 hours
#### 0.6

question: If the speed of a man is 51 km per hour, then what is the distance traveled by him in 30 seconds?
solution:
First convert the speed to meters per second: 51 km/hr * (1000 m/km) * (1 hr/3600 s) = 14.17 m/s
Then, calculate the distance traveled in 30 seconds: 14.17 m/s * 30 s = 425.1 m
#### 425.1

question: Cole drove from home to work at an average speed of 75 km/h. He then returned home at an average speed of 105 km/h. If the round trip took a total of 6 hours, how many minutes did it take Cole to drive to work?
solution:
Let x be the time it took Cole to drive to work.
Let y be the time it took Cole to drive home.
We have the system of equations: x + y = 6 and 75x = 105y.
Solving the system of equations, we get x = 2.1 hours.
Converting 2.1 hours to minutes, we get 2.1 * 60 = 126 minutes.
#### 126

question: car x began traveling at an average speed of 35 miles per hour. After 48 minutes, car y began traveling at an average speed of 39 miles per hour. When both cars had traveled the same distance, both cars stopped. How many miles did car x travel from the time car y began traveling until both cars stopped?
solution:
Car x traveled for 48 minutes at 35 mph, which is 35 * 48 / 60 = 28 miles.
Car y traveled at 39 mph for the same amount of time, which is 39 * 48 / 60 = 31.2 miles.
Car x traveled 28 miles before car y began traveling.
#### 28

question: Excluding the stoppages, the speed of a bus is 64 km/hr and including the stoppages the speed of the bus is 48 km/hr. For how many minutes does the bus stop per hour?
solution:
Let the time the bus stops be x hours.
64 = 48 + x
x = 16
The bus stops for 16 minutes per hour.
#### 16

question: Excluding stoppages, the speed of a bus is 80 kmph and including stoppages, it is 60 kmph. For how many minutes does the bus stop per hour?
solution:
Let the time the bus stops be x minutes.
Distance = Speed x Time
80 = 60 + (60/60)x
80 = 60 + x
x = 20
The bus stops for 20 minutes per hour.
#### 20

question: A searchlight on top of the watch-tower makes 2 revolutions per minute. What is the probability that a man appearing near the tower will stay in the dark for at least 5 seconds?
solution:
The searchlight makes 2 x 60 = 120 revolutions per hour.
The searchlight makes 120 / 360 = 1/3 revolution per minute.
The probability of a man staying in the dark for at least 5 seconds is 1 - (1/3)^5 = 1 - (1/243) = 242/243.
#### 242/243

question: If Teena is driving at 55 miles per hour and is currently 7.5 miles behind Joe, who is driving at 40 miles per hour in the same direction. In how many minutes will Teena be 22.5 miles ahead of Joe?
solution:
Teena is gaining on Joe at a rate of 55 - 40 = 15 miles per hour
It will take Teena 7.5 / 15 = 0.5 hours to catch up to Joe
Teena will be 22.5 miles ahead of Joe in 0.5 hours x 3 = 1.5 hours
Teena will be 22.5 miles ahead of Joe in 1.5 hours x 60 = 90 minutes
#### 90

question: if 20 typists can type 38 letters in 20 minutes, then how many letters will 30 typists working at the same rate complete in 1 hour?
solution:
One typist can type 38 letters in 20 x 20 = 400 minutes.
One typist can type 38 x 20 = 760 letters in 400 minutes.
30 typists can type 30 x 760 = 22800 letters in 400 minutes.
30 typists can type 22800 x 3 = 68400 letters in 1200 minutes.
30 typists can type 68400 letters in 1200 / 60 = 1140 minutes.
30 typists can type 68400 letters in 1140 / 60 = 19 hours.
#### 68400

question: A mobile battery in 1 hour charges to 20 percent. How much time (in minutes) will it require more to charge to 60 percent?
solution:
It charges 20% in 1 hour, so it charges 1% in 1/20 hours because 1 / 20 = 0.05
It will take 3 times as long to charge to 60% because 60 / 20 = 3
It will take 3/20 hours to charge to 60% because 0.05 x 3 = 0.15
It will take 9 minutes to charge to 60% because 0.15 x 60 = 9
#### 9

question: Excluding stoppages, the speed of a bus is 54 kmph and including stoppages, it is 45 kmph. For how many minutes does the bus stop per hour?
solution:
Let the time the bus stops be x minutes.
Distance = Speed x Time
54 = 45 + (45/60)x
54 = 45 + 0.75x
9 = 0.75x
x = 12
#### 12

question: Sarah is driving to the airport. After driving at 50 miles per hour for one hour, she realizes that if she continues at that same average rate she will be an hour late for her flight. She then travels 100 miles per hour for the rest of the trip, and arrives 30 minutes before her flight departs. How many miles did she drive in all?
solution:
Let x be the number of hours she drove at 50 miles per hour.
She drove 50x miles at 50 miles per hour.
She then drove 100(x-1) miles at 100 miles per hour.
She drove a total of 50x + 100(x-1) miles.
She drove a total of 50x + 100x - 100 miles.
She drove a total of 150x - 100 miles.
She drove a total of 150(x - 2/3) miles.
She drove a total of 150(x - 2/3) miles.
#### 150(x - 2/3)

question: If Tina is driving at 55 miles per hour and is currently 7.5 miles behind Loe, who is driving at 40 miles per hour in the same direction, then in how many minutes will Tina be 15 miles ahead of Loe?
solution:
Tina gains 55 - 40 = 15 miles per hour because she is driving faster than Loe.
It will take Tina 1 hour to be 15 miles ahead of Loe because 15 / 15 = 1
It will take Tina 60 minutes to be 15 miles ahead of Loe because 1 x 60 = 60
#### 60

question: if 20 typists can type 44 letters in 20 minutes, then how many letters will 30 typists working at the same rate complete in 1 hour?
solution:
One typist can type 44 letters in 20 x 20 = 400 minutes.
One typist can type 44 x 3 = 132 letters in 60 minutes.
30 typists can type 30 x 132 = 3960 letters in 60 minutes.
#### 3960

question: Stacy and Heather are 20 miles apart and walk towards each other along the same route. Stacy walks at a constant rate that is 2 miles per hour faster than Heather's constant rate of 5 miles/hour. If Heather starts her journey 24 minutes after Stacy, how far from the original destination has Heather walked when the two meet?
solution:
Stacy's speed is 5 + 2 = 7 miles/hour
Heather's time is 24/60 = 0.4 hours
Stacy's time is t hours
Stacy's distance is 7t
Heather's distance is 5(0.4 + t)
When they meet, their distances sum to 20: 7t + 5(0.4 + t) = 20
7t + 2 + 5t = 20
12t + 2 = 20
12t = 18
t = 1.5
Heather's distance is 5(0.4 + 1.5) = 5(1.9) = 9.5 miles
#### 9.5

question: Someone on a skateboard is traveling 10 miles per hour. How many feet does she travel in 20 seconds? (1 mile = 5280 feet)
solution:
She travels 10 x 5280 = 52800 feet in an hour because 10 x 5280 = 52800
She travels 52800 / 3600 = 14.67 feet in a second because 52800 / 3600 = 14.67
She travels 14.67 x 20 = 293.33 feet in 20 seconds because 14.67 x 20 = 293.33
#### 293.33

question: Excluding stoppages, the speed of a train is 45 kmph and including stoppages it is 33 kmph. Of how many minutes does the train stop per hour?
solution:
Let the time taken to cover the distance be x hours.
Distance = 45x km (speed x time)
Distance = 33x km
12x = 45x
12x-33x = 0
-21x = 0
x = 0
The train stops for 0 hours per hour.
#### 0

question: Without stoppages, a train travels a certain distance with an average speed of 400 km/h, and with stoppages, it covers the same distance with an average speed of 360 km/h. How many minutes per hour does the train stop?
solution:
Let x be the time the train stops in hours.
Distance = Speed x Time
400 = 360 + 40x
40 = 40x
x = 1 hour
The train stops for 60 minutes per hour.
#### 60

question: Excluding stoppages, the average speed of a bus is 60 km/hr and including stoppages, the average speed of the bus is 45 km/hr. For how many minutes does the bus stop per hour?
solution:
Let the time the bus stops be x minutes per hour.
Total distance = 60 km
Total time = 1 hour
Speed excluding stoppages = 60 km/hr
Total distance = 45 km
Total time = 1 hour
Speed including stoppages = 45 km/hr
60 = 45 + (45x/60)
60 = 45 + 3x/4
60 - 45 = 3x/4
15 = 3x/4
x = 20
#### 20

question: A crow leaves its nest, and flies back and forth from its nest to a nearby ditch to gather worms. The distance between the nest and the ditch is 200 meters. In one and a half hours, the crow manages to bring worms to its nest 15 times. What is the speed of the crow in kilometers per hour?
solution:
The total distance traveled by the crow is 200 * 2 * 15 = 6000 meters because the crow goes back and forth.
The total time taken by the crow is 1.5 * 15 = 22.5 hours because the crow goes back and forth 15 times.
The speed of the crow is 6000 / 22.5 = 266.67 meters per hour.
The speed of the crow in kilometers per hour is 0.26667 kilometers per hour because 1 kilometer = 1000 meters.
#### 0.26667

question: Darcy lives 1.5 miles from work. She can walk to work at a constant rate of 3 miles per hour, or she can ride the train to work at a constant rate of 20 miles per hour. If she rides the train, there is an additional x minutes spent walking to the nearest train station, waiting for the train, and walking from the final train station to her work. If it takes Darcy a total of 15 more minutes to commute to work by walking than it takes her to commute to work by riding the train, what is the value of x?
solution:
It takes Darcy 30 minutes to walk to work because 1.5 / 3 = 0.5
It takes Darcy 4.5 minutes to ride the train to work because 1.5 / 20 x 60 = 4.5
It takes Darcy 15 minutes longer to walk to work than to ride the train because 30 - 4.5 = 25.5
It takes Darcy x minutes to commute to work by walking than it takes her to commute to work by riding the train because 25.5 = x
#### 25.5

question: if a child walks at the rate of 5 m / min from his home, he is 6 minutes late for school, if he walks at the rate of 7 m / min he reaches half an hour earlier. how far is his school from his home?
solution:
Let the distance be x.
According to the given information, x/5 - x/7 = 6
Multiplying through by 35, we get 7x - 5x = 210
2x = 210
x = 105
#### 105

question: a train is moving at 6 / 7 of its usual speed . the train is 15 minutes too late . what is the usual time ( in hours ) for the train to complete the journey ?
solution:
Let the usual time be x hours.
Then, the time taken at 6/7 of the usual speed = (7/6)x hours.
Given that (7/6)x - x = 15/60 hours.
Solving the equation, we get x = 2.5 hours.
#### 2.5

question: A car traveling at a certain constant speed takes 5 seconds longer to travel 1 km than it would take to travel 1 km at 90 km / hour. At what speed, in km / hr, is the car traveling?
solution:
Let x be the speed of the car.
Time taken to travel 1 km at speed x is 1/x hours.
Time taken to travel 1 km at 90 km/hr is 1/90 hours.
1/x - 1/90 = 5/3600 (converting 5 seconds to hours)
1/x = 1/90 + 5/3600
1/x = 1/90 + 1/720
1/x = 9/720 + 1/720
1/x = 10/720
1/x = 1/72
x = 72
#### 72

question: Excluding stoppages, the speed of a bus is 54 kmph and including stoppages, it is 36 kmph. For how many minutes does the bus stop per hour?
solution:
Let the time that the bus stops be x minutes.
Distance = Speed x Time
54 (54-x) = 36 (60)
54(54-x) = 36(60)
54(54-x) = 2160
54x = 2160 - 2916
54x = 756
x = 14
#### 14

question: A leak in the bottom of a tank can empty the full tank in 6 hours. An inlet pipe fills water at the rate of 6 litres a minute. When the tank is full, the inlet is opened and due to the leak, the tank is empty in 12 hours. How many litres does the cistern hold?
solution:
The leak empties the tank at a rate of 1/6 of the tank per hour because 1 / 6 = 1/6
The inlet fills the tank at a rate of 6 liters per minute because 6 x 60 = 360
The inlet fills the tank at a rate of 1/6 of the tank per hour because 360 / 60 = 6
The combined rate of the leak and the inlet is -1/6 + 1/6 = 0
The tank holds 72 liters because 6 x 12 = 72
#### 72

question: If Teena is driving at 55 miles per hour and is currently 7.5 miles behind Joe, who is driving at 40 miles per hour in the same direction. In how many minutes will Teena be 30 miles ahead of Joe?
solution:
Teena gains 55 - 40 = 15 miles per hour because she is driving faster than Joe.
It will take Teena 0.5 hours to be 30 miles ahead of Joe because 30 / 15 = 2
Teena will be 30 miles ahead of Joe in 30 minutes because 0.5 x 60 = 30
#### 30

question: Circular gears p and q start rotating at the same time at constant speeds. Gear p makes 10 revolutions per minute and gear q makes 40 revolutions per minute. How many seconds after the gears start rotating will gear q have made exactly 5 more revolutions than gear p?
solution:
Gear q makes 40 - 10 = 30 more revolutions per minute than gear p.
It will take 1 minute for gear q to make 30 revolutions more than gear p because 30 / 30 = 1
It will take 60 seconds for gear q to make 30 revolutions more than gear p because 1 x 60 = 60
Gear q will have made 5 more revolutions than gear p after 30 seconds because 60 / 2 = 30
#### 30
